cvrfdoc.DocumentTitle: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

DocumentPublisher.ContactDetails: Emergency Support: +1 877 228 7302 (toll-free within North America) +1 408 525 6532 (International direct-dial) Non-emergency Support: Email: psirt@cisco.com Support requests that are received via e-mail are typically acknowledged within 48 hours.
DocumentPublisher.IssuingAuthority: Cisco product security incident response is the responsibility of the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT). The Cisco PSIRT is a dedicated, global team that manages the receipt, investigation, and public reporting of security vulnerability information that is related to Cisco products and networks. The on-call Cisco PSIRT works 24x7 with Cisco customers, independent security researchers, consultants, industry organizations, and other vendors to identify possible security issues with Cisco products and networks. More information can be found in Cisco Security Vulnerability Policy available at http://www.cisco.com/web/about/security/psirt/security_vulnerability_policy.html

DocumentNotes.Note:
Multiple Cisco products incorporate a version of the OpenSSL package affected by one or more vulnerabilities that could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition or corrupt portions of OpenSSL process memory. On March 19, 2015, the OpenSSL Project released a security advisory detailing 13 distinct vulnerabilities. The following seven are actively under investigation and the vulnerabilities are referenced in this document as follows:
CVE-2015-0286: OpenSSL ASN1_TYPE_cmp Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2015-0287: OpenSSL ASN.1 Structure Reuse Memory Corruption Vulnerability CVE-2015-0289: OpenSSL PKCS7 NULL Pointer Dereference Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2015-0292: OpenSSL Base64 Decoding Memory Corruption Vulnerability CVE-2015-0293: OpenSSL SSLv2 CLIENT-MASTER-KEY Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2015-0209: OpenSSL Elliptic Curve d2i_ECPrivateKey Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2015-0288: OpenSSL X.509 to PKCS#10 Denial of Service Vulnerability
The following six vulnerabilities do not affect any Cisco products:
CVE-2015-0291: OpenSSL ClientHello sigalgs Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2015-0290: OpenSSL Multiblock Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2015-0207: OpenSSL DTLSv1_listen SSL Object Corruption Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2015-0208: OpenSSL Invalid Probabilistic Signature Scheme Parameters Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2015-1787: OpenSSL Empty ClientKeyExchange Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2015-0285: OpenSSL Handshake with Unseeded PRNG Predictable Value Vulnerability
This advisory will be updated as additional information becomes available.
Cisco will release software updates that address these vulnerabilities.
Workarounds that mitigate these vulnerabilities may be available.
This advisory is available at the following link:
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150320-openssl["http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150320-openssl"]

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

Vulnerability.Title: OpenSSL ClientHello sigalgs Denial of Service Vulnerability

Notes.Note:
A vulnerability in OpenSSL could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.
The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of signature algorithm extensions by the affected software. An unauthenticated, remote attacker on an OpenSSL client could exploit this vulnerability by establishing a connection with a targeted OpenSSL server and sending a renegotiation request to the server using a crafted signature algorithm extension. A NULL pointer deference condition could occur, resulting in a DoS condition.

Remediation.Description: For potential workarounds on a specific Cisco product, refer to the Cisco bug ID, which is available from the Cisco Bug Search Tool["https://tools.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/BUGID"].

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

Notes.Note:
An issue in the multiblock feature of OpenSSL could result in the failure of client connections.
The issue is due to an implementation error in the OpenSSL multiblock performance feature. On 64-bit platforms, the implementation error could set a memory pointer to NULL, causing an error condition that could prevent client connections. An attacker has no way to exploit this issue because there is no vector to manipulate the memory in use by the multiblock feature.

Remediation.Description: For potential workarounds on a specific Cisco product, refer to the Cisco bug ID, which is available from the Cisco Bug Search Tool["https://tools.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/BUGID"].

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

Vulnerability.Title: OpenSSL DTLSv1_listen Segmentation Fault Denial of Service Vulnerability

Notes.Note:
A vulnerability in OpenSSL could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.
The vulnerability is due to improper program state maintenance between function calls. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious requests to the affected system. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the application using OpenSSL to terminate, resulting in a DoS condition.

Remediation.Description: For potential workarounds on a specific Cisco product, refer to the Cisco bug ID, which is available from the Cisco Bug Search Tool["https://tools.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/BUGID"].

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

Vulnerability.Title: OpenSSL ASN.1 Structure Reuse Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Notes.Note:
A vulnerability in OpenSSL could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.
The vulnerability is due to improper memory operations performed by the affected software. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by reusing an ASN.1 structure. When processed by an application using an affected library, a memory corruption error may occur that could allow the attacker to cause a denial of service condition on a targeted system.

Remediation.Description: For potential workarounds on a specific Cisco product, refer to the Cisco bug ID, which is available from the Cisco Bug Search Tool["https://tools.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/BUGID"].

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

Vulnerability.Title: OpenSSL PKCS7 NULL Pointer Dereference Vulnerability

Notes.Note:
A vulnerability in OpenSSL could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.
The vulnerability exists within the Public-Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) parsing module due improper validation of PKCS7-encoded data. An unauthenticated, remote attacker could exploit the vulnerability by providing crafted PKCS-encoded data to the affected system. Processing the crafted data could cause a DoS condition.

Remediation.Description: For potential workarounds on a specific Cisco product, refer to the Cisco bug ID, which is available from the Cisco Bug Search Tool["https://tools.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/BUGID"].

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

Vulnerability.Title: OpenSSL Base64 Decode Remote Denial of Service Vulnerability

Notes.Note:
A vulnerability in OpenSSL could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.
The vulnerability is due to improper processing of data with base64 encoding. An unauthenticated, remote attacker could exploit the vulnerability by providing crafted data to the targeted system. Processing such data could result in a DoS condition.

Remediation.Description: For potential workarounds on a specific Cisco product, refer to the Cisco bug ID, which is available from the Cisco Bug Search Tool["https://tools.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/BUGID"].

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

Vulnerability.Title: OpenSSL SSLv2 Servers Reachable Assert Denial of Service Vulnerability

Notes.Note:
A vulnerability in OpenSSL could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.
The vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input submitted to a system running the affected software. An unauthenticated, remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by submitting a crafted SSLv2 CLIENT-MASTER-KEY message to a targeted system. If successful, the attacker could trigger an OPENSSL_assert (abort) condition, resulting in a DoS condition.

Remediation.Description: For potential workarounds on a specific Cisco product, refer to the Cisco bug ID, which is available from the Cisco Bug Search Tool["https://tools.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/BUGID"].

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

Vulnerability.Title: OpenSSL Empty ClientKeyExchange Message Denial of Service Vulnerability

Notes.Note:
A vulnerability in OpenSSL could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.
The vulnerability occurs during the client authentication phase due to improper validation of session messages. An unauthenticated, remote attacker could exploit the vulnerability by transmitting crafted session messages to a targeted system. If successful, the attacker could cause a DoS condition.

Remediation.Description: For potential workarounds on a specific Cisco product, refer to the Cisco bug ID, which is available from the Cisco Bug Search Tool["https://tools.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/BUGID"].

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

Notes.Note:
An issue in OpenSSL could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to disclose sensitive information.
The issue exists because the affected library uses unseeded handshake sessions and may generate an insecure pseudorandom number generator (PRNG) secret which is used to encrypt network traffic from insufficient entropy. An unauthenticated, remote attacker could exploit the issue by successfully completing a handshake without providing a seed and may predict the session secret to disclose sensitive session information.

Remediation.Description: For potential workarounds on a specific Cisco product, refer to the Cisco bug ID, which is available from the Cisco Bug Search Tool["https://tools.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/BUGID"].

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

Notes.Note:
A vulnerability in OpenSSL could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition.
The vulnerability is due to improper handling of an Elliptic Curve (EC) private key file during authentication. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by transmitting a crafted private session key to the targeted system. When the key is processed, the attacker could cause a memory corruption error on the targeted system.

Remediation.Description: For potential workarounds on a specific Cisco product, refer to the Cisco bug ID, which is available from the Cisco Bug Search Tool["https://tools.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/BUGID"].

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products

Vulnerability.Title: OpenSSL X509_to_X509_REQ NULL Pointer Dereference Denial of Service Vulnerability

Notes.Note:
The vulnerability exists because of a memory pointer dereference error when the affected software handles malicious X.509 certificates.
An unauthenticated, remote attacker could exploit the vulnerability by transmitting a crafted X.509 certificate authentication request to a targeted system. When processed, the request could cause a NULL pointer dereference error that may cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on the system.

Remediation.Description: For potential workarounds on a specific Cisco product, refer to the Cisco bug ID, which is available from the Cisco Bug Search Tool["https://tools.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/BUGID"].

Reference.Description: Multiple Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (March 2015) Affecting Cisco Products
